result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A. Reick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert A. Reick is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert A. Reick was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Robert A. Reick was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Robert A. Reick in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Long stated there is a victim present that would like to make a statement. Atty Riek objected, she is not the victim of the crime he is being sentenced for today. Court permitted victim to make a statement. T.S. gave statement to the court. Sentencing recommendation argued. Defendant made a statement to the Court. Court sentenced the defendant on Ct. 2 to serve 8 years in prison, consecutive to any other sentence, 4 years initial confinement and 4 years extended supervision. Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program. 524 days jail credit. D.O.C. agent is to update the summary to show the days the defendant spent in MSDF. 11:05/12:15
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 25, 2018 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Robert A. Reick in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State objects to all the Motions that were filed - Motion to exclude prior convictions, jail phone calls, and crime lab.  Argument for Motions given by Atty Riek.  Argument against Motions by State.  Court granted Motion to exclude prior convictions from 2004.  Court denied the Motion as it relates to the Crime Lab evidence and jail phone calls.  Found there was no reasonable delay in regards to phone calls being received.  Atty Riek addressed the Motion in Limine regarding audio, if transcripts need to be ordered prior to court for DVD/CD's.  Court will not require transcripts for the DVD/CD's.  9:06/9:53
